blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling multi-aquifer well package behavior and output.

variables.name: FLOWING_WELLS
variables.description: Keyword to activate the flowing wells option, allowing wells to flow at the land surface when the head exceeds the well top.
variables.tooltip: When specified, wells that have a head above the specified flowing well elevation will discharge at a rate controlled by the flowing well conductance. Simulates artesian flowing wells.

variables.name: SHUTDOWN_THETA
variables.description: Value that defines the weight for smoothly reducing pumping when the water level drops near the bottom of the well.
variables.tooltip: Controls the smoothing function for reducing well pumping as the water level approaches the well bottom. Used to prevent abrupt changes in pumping rate. Typical values are 0.5 to 0.9.

variables.name: SHUTDOWN_KAPPA
variables.description: Value that defines the range over which the pumping shutdown occurs.
variables.tooltip: Defines the interval over which pumping transitions from full rate to zero as the well water level declines. Larger values provide a wider transition zone. Typical value is 0.0001.

variables.name: PRINT_INPUT
variables.description: Keyword to print MAW input data to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, multi-aquifer well data is echoed to the listing file for verification.

variables.name: PRINT_HEAD
variables.description: Keyword to print computed well head to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, the computed head in each multi-aquifer well is printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: PRINT_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to print MAW flow rates to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, flow rates for each well and well-aquifer connection are printed to the listing file.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save MAW flow terms to the cell-by-cell budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, well-aquifer flow exchange terms are written to the binary budget file.

variables.name: HEAD FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary file for writing well head output.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for saving computed well heads over time. Used for post-processing well performance.

variables.name: BUDGET FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary file for writing detailed MAW budget output.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for saving the detailed well budget including pumping, aquifer exchange, and storage.

blocks.name: PACKAGEDATA
blocks.description: Static well data defining the physical properties of each multi-aquifer well.

variables.name: WELLNO
variables.description: Well number (sequential, one-based identifier).
variables.tooltip: Unique identifier for each multi-aquifer well, numbered from 1 to the total number of wells.

variables.name: RADIUS
variables.description: Radius of the well bore, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The physical radius of the well casing. Used to compute well storage volume and, for some conductance equations, the flow area between the well and the aquifer.

variables.name: BOTTOM
variables.description: Elevation of the bottom of the well, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The bottom of the well screen or open interval. Defines the lowest point where flow can exchange between the well and the aquifer.

variables.name: STRT
variables.description: Starting head in the well at the beginning of the simulation.
variables.tooltip: Initial water level in the well. For steady-state simulations, serves as the initial guess. For transient simulations, used as the initial condition.

variables.name: CONDEQN
variables.description: Equation type used to compute well-aquifer conductance.
variables.tooltip: SPECIFIED uses user-defined conductance. THIEM uses Thiem equation (based on cell dimensions). SKIN uses skin factor. CUMULATIVE computes cumulative transmissivity. MEAN uses mean transmissivity.

variables.name: NGWFNODES
variables.description: Number of GWF model cells connected to this well.
variables.tooltip: The number of aquifer cells that the well is open to. Must match the number of CONNECTIONDATA entries for this well. Typically equals the number of layers the well penetrates.

blocks.name: CONNECTIONDATA
blocks.description: Well-aquifer connection data linking each well to its connected GWF cells.

variables.name: WELLNO
variables.description: Well number for which connections are specified.
variables.tooltip: The well number from PACKAGEDATA to which these connections apply.

variables.name: ICON
variables.description: Connection number (sequential within each well, one-based).
variables.tooltip: Sequential identifier for each well-aquifer connection, numbered from 1 to NGWFNODES for this well.

variables.name: CELLID
variables.description: Cell identifier for the connected GWF cell.
variables.tooltip: Identifies the aquifer cell connected to the well at this screen interval.

variables.name: SCRN_TOP
variables.description: Top elevation of the well screen for this connection, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The top of the screened interval in this aquifer layer. Must be within or at the boundary of the connected cell.

variables.name: SCRN_BOT
variables.description: Bottom elevation of the well screen for this connection, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The bottom of the screened interval in this aquifer layer. Must be less than SCRN_TOP.

variables.name: HK_SKIN
variables.description: Hydraulic conductivity of the skin (well damage zone) around the well, in model length per time units.
variables.tooltip: Hydraulic conductivity of the damaged or enhanced zone around the well bore. Used with the SKIN conductance equation. Lower values indicate more well damage.

variables.name: RADIUS_SKIN
variables.description: Radius of the skin zone around the well, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The outer radius of the skin zone. Must be greater than the well RADIUS. The skin zone represents the area around the well affected by drilling or development.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data specifying time-varying well settings.

variables.name: WELLNO
variables.description: Well number for which settings are specified.
variables.tooltip: The well number from PACKAGEDATA to which the following setting applies.

variables.name: MAWSETTING
variables.description: Keyword and value pair specifying a time-varying property for the well.
variables.tooltip: STATUS sets the well state (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, CONSTANT). RATE specifies the pumping rate (negative for extraction). FLOWING_WELL sets the flowing well elevation and conductance. RATE_SCALING defines the head-dependent pumping schedule. HEAD_LIMIT sets the minimum head below which pumping ceases.
